titleStmt.title: Vulnere virescit virtus. The Lord Robert Duddelye.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: Vulnere virescit virtus. The Lord Robert Duddelye.

monogr.title: The most noble, auncient, and learned playe, called the philosophers game : inuented for the honest recreation of students, and other sober persons, in passing the tediousnes of tyme, to the release of their labours, and the exercise of their wittes. Set forth with such playne precepts, rules, and tables, that all men with ease may vnderstande it, and most men with pleasure practise it. by Rafe Leuer and augmented by W.F
monogr.author: Lever, Ralph

figure.head: Vulnere virescit virtus. The Lord Robert Duddelye.

div.l: The Physnogmie here figured, appeares by Paynters Arte:
But valyant are the vertues that, possesse the inward parte.
Whych in no wise may paynted be, yet playnely do appeare.
& shine abrod in euery place with beames most bright & clear
